solution:
We know that $|a|\cdot|b|=|ab|$, so  \begin{align*}
|4+2i|\cdot|6-3i|&=|(4+2i)(6-3i)|\\
&=|2\cdot3(2+i)(2-i)|\\
&=|2\cdot3\cdot5|\\
&=30.
\end{align*}Therefore our answer is $\boxed{30}$.
gptanswer: Using the formula $|a+bi|=\sqrt{a^2+b^2}$, we have $|(4+2i)|=\sqrt{4^2+2^2}=2\sqrt{5}$ and $|(6-3i)|=\sqrt{6^2+(-3)^2}=3\sqrt{5}$. Therefore, $|(4+2i)|\cdot|(6-3i)|=2\sqrt{5}\cdot3\sqrt{5}=\boxed{30}$.
